meanings.definition: To spill or splash liquid carelessly
meanings.sent1: She was slopping water while washing the dishes.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to slop the milk when pouring it into the glass.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the bowl, slopping water everywhere!
meanings.sent4: The rain slopped over the edges of the gutter, creating a mini waterfall.
meanings.sent5: The clumsy waiter slopped soup on the customer's lap.

meanings.sent1: The slopping on the table was quickly wiped up.
meanings.sent2: The children left a trail of slopping on the kitchen floor.
meanings.sent3: The slopping from the bucket made a funny pattern on the ground.
meanings.sent4: The slopping in the sink indicated a messy cooking session.
meanings.sent5: The slopping on her dress was a result of the playful water fight.

meanings.definition: The sound of liquid being carelessly spilled or splashed
meanings.sent1: The slopping of the water in the bucket was loud.
meanings.sent2: The slopping of the rain on the roof was soothing.
meanings.sent3: The slopping of the drink on the floor startled the cat.
meanings.sent4: The slopping of the fountain water echoed through the park.
meanings.sent5: The slopping of the waves against the boat was calming.
